title: Measuring central charge on a universal quantum processor
excerpt: First experimental extraction of CFT central charge on IBM quantum hardware.
citation: N. U. Köylüoğlu, S. Majumder, **M. Amico*** et al., “Measuring central charge on a universal quantum processor,” arXiv:2408.06342 (2024).

title: Tensor Network enhanced Dynamic Multiproduct Formulas
excerpt: Tensor-network compression plus high-order MPF for longer-time quantum simulation.
citation: N. F. Robertson, B. Pokharel, **M. Amico*** et al., “Tensor Network enhanced Dynamic Multiproduct Formulas,” arXiv:2407.17405 (2024).

title: Diagonalization of large many-body Hamiltonians on a quantum processor
excerpt: Krylov-subspace diagonalization of 50-qubit 2-D lattices on IBM devices.
citation: N. Yoshioka, **M. Amico*** et al., “Diagonalization of large many-body Hamiltonians on a quantum processor,” arXiv:2407.14431 (2024).

title: Gravitational-wave matched filtering on a quantum computer
excerpt: Quantum circuits replicate matched filtering for GW detection.
citation: D. Veske, C. Tüysüz, **M. Amico*** et al., “Gravitational-wave matched filtering on a quantum computer,” *Phys. Scr.* 99, 75117 (2024).

title: Suppressing correlated noise in quantum computers via context-aware compiling
excerpt: Context-aware routing yields ≈18 % fidelity gain on heavy-hex chips.
citation: A. Seif, H. Liao, **M. Amico*** et al., “Suppressing correlated noise in quantum computers via context-aware compiling,” arXiv:2403.06852 (2024).

title: Defining Best Practices for Quantum Benchmarks
excerpt: Framework for fair, hardware-agnostic NISQ benchmarking.
citation: **M. Amico***, H. Zhang, P. Jurcevic et al., “Defining Best Practices for Quantum Benchmarks,” *IEEE QCE 2023*, 692-702 (2023).

title: Defining Standard Strategies for Quantum Benchmarks
citation: **M. Amico***, H. Zhang, P. Jurcevic et al., “Defining Standard Strategies for Quantum Benchmarks,” arXiv:2303.02108 (2023).

title: Quantum encoding is suitable for matched filtering
excerpt: Grover-based matched filtering with O(L log²L) complexity.
citation: D. Veske, C. Tüysüz, **M. Amico*** et al., “Quantum encoding is suitable for matched filtering,” arXiv:2204.04159 (2022).

title: Experimental deep reinforcement learning for error-robust gate-set design on a superconducting quantum computer
excerpt: AI-discovered pulses cut two-qubit errors >2× on IBM hardware.
citation: Y. Baum, **M. Amico*** et al., “Experimental deep reinforcement learning for error-robust gate-set design on a superconducting quantum computer,” *PRX Quantum* 2, 040324 (2021).

title: Simulation of wave-particle duality in multipath interferometers on a quantum computer
excerpt: First 16-path wave–particle duality experiment on NISQ hardware.
citation: **M. Amico**, C. Dittel, “Simulation of wave-particle duality in multipath interferometers on a quantum computer,” *Phys. Rev. A* 102, 032605 (2020).

title: An experimental study of Shor’s factoring algorithm on IBM Q
excerpt: Compiled Shor’s algorithm for N = 15, 21, 35 on superconducting qubits.
citation: **M. Amico**, Z. H. Saleem, M. Kumph, “An experimental study of Shor’s factoring algorithm on IBM Q,” *Phys. Rev. A* 100, 012305 (2019).

title: Dissipative quantum entanglement dynamics of two and three qubits due to the dynamical Lamb effect
excerpt: Time-dependent Lamb shift generates multipartite entanglement.
citation: **M. Amico**, O. L. Berman, R. Ya. Kezerashvili, “Dissipative quantum entanglement dynamics of two and three qubits due to the dynamical Lamb effect,” *Phys. Rev. A* 98, 042325 (2018).
